ayas.arabic: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
ayas.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
ayas.transliteration: bismillāhir raḥmānir raḥīm

ayas.arabic: ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنزَلَ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَلَمْ يَجْعَل لَّهُۥ عِوَجَا ۜ
ayas.translation: (All) praise is due to Allah, Who revealed the Book to His servant and did not make in it any crookedness.
ayas.transliteration: al-ḥamdu lillāhil ladhī anzala `alā `abdihil kitāba walam yaj`al lahu `iwajā ۜ

ayas.arabic: قَيِّمًا لِّيُنذِرَ بَأْسًا شَدِيدًا مِّن لَّدُنْهُ وَيُبَشِّرَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ أَنَّ لَهُمْ أَجْرًا حَسَنًا
ayas.translation: Rightly directing, that he might give warning of severe punishment from Him and give good news to the believers who do good that they shall have a goodly reward,
ayas.transliteration: qayyimal liyundhira ba-san shadīdan min ladunhu wayubashhiral mu-minīnal ladhīna ya`malūnaṣ ṣāliḥāti anna lahum ajran ḥasanā

ayas.arabic: مَّـٰكِثِينَ فِيهِ أَبَدًا
ayas.translation: Staying in it for ever;
ayas.transliteration: mākithīna fīhi abadā

ayas.arabic: وَيُنذِرَ ٱلَّذِينَ قَالُوا۟ ٱتَّخَذَ ٱللَّهُ وَلَدًا
ayas.translation: And warn those who say: Allah has taken a son.
ayas.transliteration: wayundhiral ladhīna qālut-takhadhallāhu waladā

ayas.arabic: مَّا لَهُم بِهِۦ مِنْ عِلْمٍ وَلَا لِـَٔابَآئِهِمْ ۚ كَبُرَتْ كَلِمَةً تَخْرُجُ مِنْ أَفْوَٰهِهِمْ ۚ إِن يَقُولُونَ إِلَّا كَذِبًا
ayas.translation: They have no knowledge of it, nor had their fathers; a grievous word it is that comes out of their mouths; they speak nothing but a lie.
ayas.transliteration: mā lahum bihi min `il-min walā li-ābā-ihim ۚ kaburat kalimatan takhruju min afwāhihim ۚ in yaqūlūna illā kadhibā

ayas.arabic: فَلَعَلَّكَ بَـٰخِعٌ نَّفْسَكَ عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَـٰرِهِمْ إِن لَّمْ يُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ أَسَفًا
ayas.translation: Then maybe you will kill yourself with grief, sorrowing after them, if they do not believe in this announcement.
ayas.transliteration: fala`allaka bākhi`un nafsaka `alā āthārihim in lam yu-minū bihādhal ḥadīthi asafā

ayas.arabic: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا مَا عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ زِينَةً لَّهَا لِنَبْلُوَهُمْ أَيُّهُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًا
ayas.translation: Surely We have made whatever is on the earth an embellishment for it, so that We may try them (as to) which of them is best in works.
ayas.transliteration: innā ja`alnā mā `alal-arḍi zīnatan lahā linabluwahum ayyuhum aḥsanu `amalā

ayas.arabic: وَإِنَّا لَجَـٰعِلُونَ مَا عَلَيْهَا صَعِيدًا جُرُزًا
ayas.translation: And most surely We will make what is on it bare ground without herbage.
ayas.transliteration: wa innā lajā`ilūna mā `alayhā ṣa`īdan juruzā

ayas.arabic: أَمْ حَسِبْتَ أَنَّ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْكَهْفِ وَٱلرَّقِيمِ كَانُوا۟ مِنْ ءَايَـٰتِنَا عَجَبًا
ayas.translation: Or, do you think that the Fellows of the Cave and the Inscription were of Our wonderful signs?
ayas.transliteration: am ḥasibta anna aṣ-ḥābal kahfi war raqīmi kānū min āyātinā `ajabā

ayas.arabic: إِذْ أَوَى ٱلْفِتْيَةُ إِلَى ٱلْكَهْفِ فَقَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَآ ءَاتِنَا مِن لَّدُنكَ رَحْمَةً وَهَيِّئْ لَنَا مِنْ أَمْرِنَا رَشَدًا
ayas.translation: When the youths sought refuge in the cave, they said: Our Lord! grant us mercy from Thee, and provide for us a right course in our affair.
ayas.transliteration: idh awal fityatu ilal-kahfi faqālū rabbanā ātinā min ladunka raḥmatan wahayyi-lanā min amrinā rashadā

ayas.arabic: فَضَرَبْنَا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ فِى ٱلْكَهْفِ سِنِينَ عَدَدًا
ayas.translation: So We prevented them from hearing in the cave for a number of years.
ayas.transliteration: faḍarabnā `alā ādhānihim fil kahfi sinīna `adadā

ayas.arabic: ثُمَّ بَعَثْنَـٰهُمْ لِنَعْلَمَ أَىُّ ٱلْحِزْبَيْنِ أَحْصَىٰ لِمَا لَبِثُوٓا۟ أَمَدًا
ayas.translation: Then We raised them up that We might know which of the two parties was best able to compute the time for which they remained.
ayas.transliteration: thumma ba`athnāhum lina`lama ayyul ḥizbayni aḥṣā limā labithū amadā

ayas.arabic: نَّحْنُ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ نَبَأَهُم بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ فِتْيَةٌ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِرَبِّهِمْ وَزِدْنَـٰهُمْ هُدًى
ayas.translation: We relate to you their story with the truth; surely they were youths who believed in their Lord and We increased them in guidance.
ayas.transliteration: naḥnu naquṣṣu `alayka naba-ahum bil ḥaqq ۚ innahum fityatun āmanū birabbihim wazidnāhum hudā

ayas.arabic: وَرَبَطْنَا عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ إِذْ قَامُوا۟ فَقَالُوا۟ رَبُّنَا رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ لَن نَّدْعُوَا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ إِلَـٰهًا ۖ لَّقَدْ قُلْنَآ إِذًا شَطَطًا
ayas.translation: And We strengthened their hearts with patience, when they stood up and said: Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth; we will by no means call upon any god besides Him, for then indeed we should have said an extravagant thing.
ayas.transliteration: warabaṭnā `alā qulūbihim idh qāmū faqālū rabbunā rabbus samāwāti wal-arḍi lan nad`uwa min dūnihi ilāhā ۖ laqad qulnā idhan shaṭaṭā

ayas.arabic: هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ قَوْمُنَا ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ ءَالِهَةً ۖ لَّوْلَا يَأْتُونَ عَلَيْهِم بِسُلْطَـٰنٍۭ بَيِّنٍ ۖ فَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا
ayas.translation: These our people have taken gods besides Him; why do they not produce any clear authority in their support? Who is then more unjust than he who forges a lie against Allah?
ayas.transliteration: hā-ulā-i qawmunat-takhadhū min dūnihi ālihah ۖ lawlā ya-tūna `alayhim bisulṭānin bayyin ۖ faman aẓlamu mimmanif-tarā `alallāhi kadhibā

ayas.arabic: وَإِذِ ٱعْتَزَلْتُمُوهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهَ فَأْوُۥٓا۟ إِلَى ٱلْكَهْفِ يَنشُرْ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّن رَّحْمَتِهِۦ وَيُهَيِّئْ لَكُم مِّنْ أَمْرِكُم مِّرْفَقًا
ayas.translation: And when you forsake them and what they worship save Allah, betake yourselves for refuge to the cave; your Lord will extend to you largely of His mercy and provide for you a profitable course in your affair.
ayas.transliteration: wa idhi'-tazaltumūhum wa mā ya`budūna illallāha fa-uwū ilal-kahfi yanshur lakum rabbukum min raḥmatihi wayuhayyi-lakum min amrikum mirfaqā

ayas.arabic: وَتَرَى ٱلشَّمْسَ إِذَا طَلَعَت تَّزَٰوَرُ عَن كَهْفِهِمْ ذَاتَ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَإِذَا غَرَبَت تَّقْرِضُهُمْ ذَاتَ ٱلشِّمَالِ وَهُمْ فِى فَجْوَةٍ مِّنْهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ ءَايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ مَن يَهْدِ ٱللَّهُ فَهُوَ ٱلْمُهْتَدِ ۖ وَمَن يُضْلِلْ فَلَن تَجِدَ لَهُۥ وَلِيًّا مُّرْشِدًا
ayas.translation: And you might see the sun when it rose, decline from their cave towards the right hand, and when it set, leave them behind on the left while they were in a wide space thereof. This is of the signs of Allah; whomsoever Allah guides, he is the rightly guided one, and whomsoever He causes to err, you shall not find for him any friend to lead (him) aright.
ayas.transliteration: watarash shamsa idhā ṭala`at tazāwaru `an kahfihim dhātal yamīni wa idhā gharabat taqriḍuhum dhātash shimāli wahum fī fajwatim minh ۚ dhālika min āyātillāh ۗ man yahdillāhu fahuwal muhtad ۖ wa man yuḍlil falan tajida lahu waliyyan murshidā

ayas.arabic: وَتَحْسَبُهُمْ أَيْقَاظًا وَهُمْ رُقُودٌ ۚ وَنُقَلِّبُهُمْ ذَاتَ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَذَاتَ ٱلشِّمَالِ ۖ وَكَلْبُهُم بَـٰسِطٌ ذِرَاعَيْهِ بِٱلْوَصِيدِ ۚ لَوِ ٱطَّلَعْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ لَوَلَّيْتَ مِنْهُمْ فِرَارًا وَلَمُلِئْتَ مِنْهُمْ رُعْبًا
ayas.translation: And you might think them awake while they were asleep and We turned them about to the right and to the left, while their dog (lay) outstretching its paws at the entrance; if you looked at them you would certainly turn back from them in flight, and you would certainly be filled with awe because of them.
ayas.transliteration: wataḥsabuhum ayqāẓan wahum ruqūd ۚ wanuqallibuhum dhātal yamīni wadhātash shimāl ۖ wakalbuhum bāsiṭun dhirā`ayhi bil waṣīd ۚ lawiṭ-ṭala`ta `alayhim lawallayta minhum firāran walamuli-ta minhum ru`bā

ayas.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ بَعَثْنَـٰهُمْ لِيَتَسَآءَلُوا۟ بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ قَالَ قَآئِلٌ مِّنْهُمْ كَمْ لَبِثْتُمْ ۖ قَالُوا۟ لَبِثْنَا يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍ ۚ قَالُوا۟ رَبُّكُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا لَبِثْتُمْ فَٱبْعَثُوٓا۟ أَحَدَكُم بِوَرِقِكُمْ هَـٰذِهِۦٓ إِلَى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ فَلْيَنظُرْ أَيُّهَآ أَزْكَىٰ طَعَامًا فَلْيَأْتِكُم بِرِزْقٍ مِّنْهُ وَلْيَتَلَطَّفْ وَلَا يُشْعِرَنَّ بِكُمْ أَحَدًا
ayas.translation: And thus did We rouse them that they might question each other. A speaker among them said: How long have you tarried? They said: We have tarried for a day or a part of a day. (Others) said: Your Lord knows best how long you have tarried. Now send one of you with this silver (coin) of yours to the city, then let him see which of them has purest food, so let him bring you provision from it, and let him behave with gentleness, and by no means make your case known to any one:
ayas.transliteration: wakadhālika ba`athnāhum liyatasā-alū baynahum ۚ qāla qā-ilun minhum kam labithtum ۖ qālū labithnā yawman aw ba`ḍa yawm ۚ qālū rabbukum a`lamu bimā labithtum fab`athū aḥadakum biwariqikum hādhihi ilal-madīnati falyanẓur ayyuhā azkā ṭa`āman falya-tikum birizqin minhu walyatalaṭṭaf walā yush`iranna bikum aḥadā

ayas.arabic: إِنَّهُمْ إِن يَظْهَرُوا۟ عَلَيْكُمْ يَرْجُمُوكُمْ أَوْ يُعِيدُوكُمْ فِى مِلَّتِهِمْ وَلَن تُفْلِحُوٓا۟ إِذًا أَبَدًا
ayas.translation: For surely if they prevail against you they would stone you to death or force you back to their religion, and then you will never succeed.
ayas.transliteration: innahum in yaẓharū `alaykum yarjumūkum aw yu`īdūkum fī millatihim walan tufliḥū idhan abadā

ayas.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَعْثَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ لِيَعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَأَنَّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهَآ إِذْ يَتَنَـٰزَعُونَ بَيْنَهُمْ أَمْرَهُمْ ۖ فَقَالُوا۟ ٱبْنُوا۟ عَلَيْهِم بُنْيَـٰنًا ۖ رَّبُّهُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِهِمْ ۚ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ غَلَبُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْرِهِمْ لَنَتَّخِذَنَّ عَلَيْهِم مَّسْجِدًا
ayas.translation: And thus did We make (men) to get knowledge of them that they might know that Allah's promise is true and that as for the hour there is no doubt about it. When they disputed among themselves about their affair and said: Erect an edifice over them-- their Lord best knows them. Those who prevailed in their affair said: We will certainly raise a masjid over them.
ayas.transliteration: wakadhālika a`tharnā `alayhim liya`lamū anna wa`dallāhi ḥaqqun wa-annas sā`ata lā rayba fīhā idh yatanāza`ūna baynahum amrahum ۖ faqālub-nū `alayhim bunyānā ۖ rabbuhum a`lamu bihim ۚ qālal ladhīna ghalabū `alā amrihim lanattakhidhanna `alayhim masjidā

ayas.arabic: سَيَقُولُونَ ثَلَـٰثَةٌ رَّابِعُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ وَيَقُولُونَ خَمْسَةٌ سَادِسُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ رَجْمًۢا بِٱلْغَيْبِ ۖ وَيَقُولُونَ سَبْعَةٌ وَثَامِنُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ ۚ قُل رَّبِّىٓ أَعْلَمُ بِعِدَّتِهِم مَّا يَعْلَمُهُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلٌ ۗ فَلَا تُمَارِ فِيهِمْ إِلَّا مِرَآءً ظَـٰهِرًا وَلَا تَسْتَفْتِ فِيهِم مِّنْهُمْ أَحَدًا
ayas.translation: (Some) say: (They are) three, the fourth of them being their dog; and (others) say: Five, the sixth of them being their dog, making conjectures at what is unknown; and (others yet) say: Seven, and the eighth of them is their dog. Say: My Lord best knows their number, none knows them but a few; therefore contend not in the matter of them but with an outward contention, and do not question concerning them any of them.
ayas.transliteration: sayaqūlūna thalāthatun rābi`uhum kalbuhum wayaqūlūna khamsatun sādisuhum kalbuhum rajman bil ghayb ۖ wayaqūlūna sab`atun wathāminuhum kalbuhum ۚ qul rabbī a`lamu bi`iddatihim mā ya`lamuhum illā qalīl ۗ falā tumāri fīhim illā mirā-an ẓāhiran walā tastafti fīhim minhum aḥadā

ayas.arabic: وَلَا تَقُولَنَّ لِشَا۟ىْءٍ إِنِّى فَاعِلٌ ذَٰلِكَ غَدًا
ayas.translation: And do not say of anything: Surely I will do it tomorrow,
ayas.transliteration: walā taqūlanna lishay-in innī fā`ilun dhālika ghadā

ayas.arabic: إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَٱذْكُر رَّبَّكَ إِذَا نَسِيتَ وَقُلْ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَهْدِيَنِ رَبِّى لِأَقْرَبَ مِنْ هَـٰذَا رَشَدًا
ayas.translation: Unless Allah pleases; and remember your Lord when you forget and say: Maybe my Lord will guide me to a nearer course to the right than this.
ayas.transliteration: illā an yashā-allāh ۚ wadhkur rabbaka idhā nasīta waqul `asā an yahdiyani rabbī li-aqraba min hādhā rashadā

ayas.arabic: وَلَبِثُوا۟ فِى كَهْفِهِمْ ثَلَـٰثَ مِا۟ئَةٍ سِنِينَ وَٱزْدَادُوا۟ تِسْعًا
ayas.translation: And they remained in their cave three hundred years and (some) add (another) nine.
ayas.transliteration: walabithū fī kahfihim thalātha mī-atin sinīna wazdādū tis`ā

ayas.arabic: قُلِ ٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا لَبِثُوا۟ ۖ لَهُۥ غَيْبُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ أَبْصِرْ بِهِۦ وَأَسْمِعْ ۚ مَا لَهُم مِّن دُونِهِۦ مِن وَلِىٍّ وَلَا يُشْرِكُ فِى حُكْمِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا
ayas.translation: Say: Allah knows best how long they remained; to Him are (known) the unseen things of the heavens and the earth; how clear His sight and how clear His hearing! There is none to be a guardian for them besides Him, and He does not make any one His associate in His Judgment.
ayas.transliteration: qulillāhu a`lamu bimā labithū ۖ lahu ghaybus samāwāti wal-arḍ ۖ abṣir bihi wa-asmi` ۚ mā lahum min dūnihi min waliyyin walā yushriku fī ḥukmihi aḥadā

ayas.arabic: وَٱتْلُ مَآ أُوحِىَ إِلَيْكَ مِن كِتَابِ رَبِّكَ ۖ لَا مُبَدِّلَ لِكَلِمَـٰتِهِۦ وَلَن تَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلْتَحَدًا
ayas.translation: And recite what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord, there is none who can alter His words; and you shall not find any refuge besides Him.
ayas.transliteration: watlu mā ūḥiya ilayka min kitābi rabbik ۖ lā mubaddila likalimātihi walan tajida min dūnihi multaḥadā

ayas.arabic: وَٱصْبِرْ نَفْسَكَ مَعَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ رَبَّهُم بِٱلْغَدَوٰةِ وَٱلْعَشِىِّ يُرِيدُونَ وَجْهَهُۥ ۖ وَلَا تَعْدُ عَيْنَاكَ عَنْهُمْ تُرِيدُ زِينَةَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَا تُطِعْ مَنْ أَغْفَلْنَا قَلْبَهُۥ عَن ذِكْرِنَا وَٱتَّبَعَ هَوَىٰهُ وَكَانَ أَمْرُهُۥ فُرُطًا
ayas.translation: And withhold yourself with those who call on their Lord morning and evening desiring His goodwill, and let not your eyes pass from them, desiring the beauties of this world's life; and do not follow him whose heart We have made unmindful to Our remembrance, and he follows his low desires and his case is one in which due bounds are exceeded.
ayas.transliteration: waṣbir nafsaka ma`al ladhīna yad`ūna rabbahum bil ghadāti wal `ashiyyi yurīdūna wajhah ۖ walā ta`du `aynāka `anhum turīdu zīnatal ḥayātid dunyā ۖ walā tuṭi` man aghfalnā qalbahu `an dhikrinā wattaba`a hawāhu wakāna amruhu furuṭā

ayas.arabic: وَقُلِ ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ فَمَن شَآءَ فَلْيُؤْمِن وَمَن شَآءَ فَلْيَكْفُرْ ۚ إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا لِلظَّـٰلِمِينَ نَارًا أَحَاطَ بِهِمْ سُرَادِقُهَا ۚ وَإِن يَسْتَغِيثُوا۟ يُغَاثُوا۟ بِمَآءٍ كَٱلْمُهْلِ يَشْوِى ٱلْوُجُوهَ ۚ بِئْسَ ٱلشَّرَابُ وَسَآءَتْ مُرْتَفَقًا
ayas.translation: And say: The truth is from your Lord, so let him who please believe, and let him who please disbelieve; surely We have prepared for the iniquitous a fire, the curtains of which shall encompass them about; and if they cry for water, they shall be given water like molten brass which will scald their faces; evil the drink and ill the resting-place.
ayas.transliteration: waqulil ḥaqqu min rabbikum ۖ faman shā-a falyu-min wa man shā-a falyakfur ۚ innā a`tadnā liẓẓālimīna nāran aḥāṭa bihim surādiquhā ۚ wa in yastaghīthū yughāthū bimā-in kal muhli yashwil wujūh ۚ bi-sash sharābu wasā-at murtafaqā

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ إِنَّا لَا نُضِيعُ أَجْرَ مَنْ أَحْسَنَ عَمَلًا
ayas.translation: Surely (as for) those who believe and do good, We do not waste the reward of him who does a good work.
ayas.transliteration: innal ladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti innā lā nuḍī`u ajra man aḥsana `amalā

ayas.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهِمُ ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ يُحَلَّوْنَ فِيهَا مِنْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٍ وَيَلْبَسُونَ ثِيَابًا خُضْرًا مِّن سُندُسٍ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٍ مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ ۚ نِعْمَ ٱلثَّوَابُ وَحَسُنَتْ مُرْتَفَقًا
ayas.translation: These it is for whom are gardens of perpetuity beneath which rivers flow, ornaments shall be given to them therein of bracelets of gold, and they shall wear green robes of fine silk and thick silk brocade interwoven with gold, reclining therein on raised couches; excellent the recompense and goodly the resting place.
ayas.transliteration: ulā-ika lahum jannātu `adnin tajrī min taḥtihimul-anhāru yuḥallawna fīhā min asāwira min dhahabin wayalbasūna thiyāban khuḍran min sundusin wa istabraqin muttaki-īna fīhā `alal-arā-ik ۚ ni`math thawābu waḥasunat murtafaqā

ayas.arabic: وَٱضْرِبْ لَهُم مَّثَلًا رَّجُلَيْنِ جَعَلْنَا لِأَحَدِهِمَا جَنَّتَيْنِ مِنْ أَعْنَـٰبٍ وَحَفَفْنَـٰهُمَا بِنَخْلٍ وَجَعَلْنَا بَيْنَهُمَا زَرْعًا
ayas.translation: And set forth to them a parable of two men; for one of them We made two gardens of grape vines, and We surrounded them both with palms, and in the midst of them We made cornfields.
ayas.transliteration: waḍrib lahum mathalan rajulayni ja`alnā li-aḥadihimā jannatayni min a`nābin waḥafafnāhumā binakhlin waja`alnā baynahumā zar`ā

ayas.arabic: كِلْتَا ٱلْجَنَّتَيْنِ ءَاتَتْ أُكُلَهَا وَلَمْ تَظْلِم مِّنْهُ شَيْـًٔا ۚ وَفَجَّرْنَا خِلَـٰلَهُمَا نَهَرًا
ayas.translation: Both these gardens yielded their fruits, and failed not aught thereof, and We caused a river to gush forth in their midst,
ayas.transliteration: kiltal jannatayni ātat ukulahā walam taẓlim minhu shay-ā ۚ wafajjarnā khilālahumā naharā

ayas.arabic: وَكَانَ لَهُۥ ثَمَرٌ فَقَالَ لِصَـٰحِبِهِۦ وَهُوَ يُحَاوِرُهُۥٓ أَنَا۠ أَكْثَرُ مِنكَ مَالًا وَأَعَزُّ نَفَرًا
ayas.translation: And he possessed much wealth; so he said to his companion, while he disputed with him: I have greater wealth than you, and am mightier in followers.
ayas.transliteration: wakāna lahu thamarun faqāla liṣāḥibihi wahuwa yuḥāwiruhu ana aktharu minka mālan wa-a`azzu nafarā

ayas.arabic: وَدَخَلَ جَنَّتَهُۥ وَهُوَ ظَالِمٌ لِّنَفْسِهِۦ قَالَ مَآ أَظُنُّ أَن تَبِيدَ هَـٰذِهِۦٓ أَبَدًا
ayas.translation: And he entered his garden while he was unjust to himself. He said: I do not think that this will ever perish
ayas.transliteration: wadakhala jannatahu wahuwa ẓālimul linafsihi qāla mā aẓunnu an tabīda hādhihi abadā

ayas.arabic: وَمَآ أَظُنُّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ قَآئِمَةً وَلَئِن رُّدِدتُّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّى لَأَجِدَنَّ خَيْرًا مِّنْهَا مُنقَلَبًا
ayas.translation: And I do not think the hour will come, and even if I am returned to my Lord I will most certainly find a returning place better than this.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā aẓunnus sā`ata qā-imatan wala-in rudidtu ilā rabbī la-ajidanna khayran minhā munqalabā

ayas.arabic: قَالَ لَهُۥ صَاحِبُهُۥ وَهُوَ يُحَاوِرُهُۥٓ أَكَفَرْتَ بِٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكَ مِن تُرَابٍ ثُمَّ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ ثُمَّ سَوَّىٰكَ رَجُلًا
ayas.translation: His companion said to him while disputing with him: Do you disbelieve in Him Who created you from dust, then from a small seed, then He made you a perfect man?
ayas.transliteration: qāla lahu ṣāḥibuhu wahuwa yuḥāwiruhu akafarta bil ladhī khalaqaka min turābin thumma min nuṭfatin thumma sawwāka rajulā

ayas.arabic: لَّـٰكِنَّا۠ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ رَبِّى وَلَآ أُشْرِكُ بِرَبِّىٓ أَحَدًا
ayas.translation: But as for me, He, Allah, is my Lord, and I do not associate anyone with my Lord.
ayas.transliteration: lākinna huwallāhu rabbī walā ushriku birabbī aḥadā

ayas.arabic: وَلَوْلَآ إِذْ دَخَلْتَ جَنَّتَكَ قُلْتَ مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِٱللَّهِ ۚ إِن تَرَنِ أَنَا۠ أَقَلَّ مِنكَ مَالًا وَوَلَدًا
ayas.translation: And wherefore did you not say when you entered your garden: It is as Allah has pleased, there is no power save in Allah? If you consider me to be inferior to you in wealth and children,
ayas.transliteration: walawlā idh dakhalta jannataka qulta mā shā-allāhu lā quwwata illā billāh ۚ in tarani ana aqalla minka mālan wawaladā

ayas.arabic: فَعَسَىٰ رَبِّىٓ أَن يُؤْتِيَنِ خَيْرًا مِّن جَنَّتِكَ وَيُرْسِلَ عَلَيْهَا حُسْبَانًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَتُصْبِحَ صَعِيدًا زَلَقًا
ayas.translation: Then maybe my Lord will give me what is better than your garden, and send on it a thunderbolt from heaven so that it shall become even ground without plant,
ayas.transliteration: fa`asā rabbī an yu-tiyani khayran min jannatika wayursila `alayhā ḥusbānan minas samā-i fatuṣbiḥa ṣa`īdan zalaqā

ayas.arabic: أَوْ يُصْبِحَ مَآؤُهَا غَوْرًا فَلَن تَسْتَطِيعَ لَهُۥ طَلَبًا
ayas.translation: Or its waters should sink down into the ground so that you are unable to find it.
ayas.transliteration: aw yuṣbiḥa mā-uhā ghawran falan tastaṭī`a lahu ṭalabā

ayas.arabic: وَأُحِيطَ بِثَمَرِهِۦ فَأَصْبَحَ يُقَلِّبُ كَفَّيْهِ عَلَىٰ مَآ أَنفَقَ فِيهَا وَهِىَ خَاوِيَةٌ عَلَىٰ عُرُوشِهَا وَيَقُولُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُشْرِكْ بِرَبِّىٓ أَحَدًا
ayas.translation: And his wealth was destroyed; so he began to wring his hands for what he had spent on it, while it lay, having fallen down upon its roofs, and he said: Ah me! would that I had not associated anyone with my Lord.
ayas.transliteration: wa-uḥīṭa bithamarihi fa-aṣbaḥa yuqallibu kaffayhi `alā mā anfaqa fīhā wahiya khāwiyatun `alā `urūshihā wayaqūlu yālaytanī lam ushrik birabbī aḥadā

ayas.arabic: وَلَمْ تَكُن لَّهُۥ فِئَةٌ يَنصُرُونَهُۥ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا كَانَ مُنتَصِرًا
ayas.translation: And he had no host to help him besides Allah nor could he defend himself.
ayas.transliteration: walam takun lahu fi-atun yanṣurūnahu min dūnillāhi wa mā kāna muntaṣirā

ayas.arabic: هُنَالِكَ ٱلْوَلَـٰيَةُ لِلَّهِ ٱلْحَقِّ ۚ هُوَ خَيْرٌ ثَوَابًا وَخَيْرٌ عُقْبًا
ayas.translation: Here is protection only Allah's, the True One; He is best in (the giving of) reward and best in requiting.
ayas.transliteration: hunālikal walāyatu lillāhil ḥaqq ۚ huwa khayrun thawāban wakhayrun `uqbā

ayas.arabic: وَٱضْرِبْ لَهُم مَّثَلَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا كَمَآءٍ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَٱخْتَلَطَ بِهِۦ نَبَاتُ ٱلْأَرْضِ فَأَصْبَحَ هَشِيمًا تَذْرُوهُ ٱلرِّيَـٰحُ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ مُّقْتَدِرًا
ayas.translation: And set forth to them parable of the life of this world: like water which We send down from the cloud so the herbage of the earth becomes tangled on account of it, then it becomes dry broken into pieces which the winds scatter; and Allah is the holder of power over all things.
ayas.transliteration: waḍrib lahum mathalal-ḥayātid dunyā kamā-in anzalnāhu minas samā-i fakhtalaṭa bihi nabātul-arḍi fa-aṣbaḥa hashīman tadhrūhur riyāḥ ۗ wakānallāhu `alā kulli shay-in muqtadirā

ayas.arabic: ٱلْمَالُ وَٱلْبَنُونَ زِينَةُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَٱلْبَـٰقِيَـٰتُ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتُ خَيْرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوَابًا وَخَيْرٌ أَمَلًا
ayas.translation: Wealth and children are an adornment of the life of this world; and the ever-abiding, the good works, are better with your Lord in reward and better in expectation.
ayas.transliteration: al-mālu wal banūna zīnatul ḥayātid dunyā ۖ wal bāqiyātuṣ ṣāliḥātu khayrun `inda rabbika thawāban wakhayrun amalā

ayas.arabic: وَيَوْمَ نُسَيِّرُ ٱلْجِبَالَ وَتَرَى ٱلْأَرْضَ بَارِزَةً وَحَشَرْنَـٰهُمْ فَلَمْ نُغَادِرْ مِنْهُمْ أَحَدًا
ayas.translation: And the day on which We will cause the mountains to pass away and you will see the earth a levelled plain and We will gather them and leave not any one of them behind.
ayas.transliteration: wayawma nusayyirul jibāla wataral-arḍa bārizatan waḥasharnāhum falam nughādir minhum aḥadā

ayas.arabic: وَعُرِضُوا۟ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ صَفًّا لَّقَدْ جِئْتُمُونَا كَمَا خَلَقْنَـٰكُمْ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍۭ ۚ بَلْ زَعَمْتُمْ أَلَّن نَّجْعَلَ لَكُم مَّوْعِدًا
ayas.translation: And they shall be brought before your Lord, standing in ranks: Now certainly you have come to Us as We created you at first. Nay, you thought that We had not appointed to you a time of the fulfillment of the promise.
ayas.transliteration: wa`uriḍū `alā rabbika ṣaffal laqad ji-tumūnā kamā khalaqnākum awwala marrah ۚ bal za`amtum allan naj`ala lakum maw`idā

ayas.arabic: وَوُضِعَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبُ فَتَرَى ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ مُشْفِقِينَ مِمَّا فِيهِ وَيَقُولُونَ يَـٰوَيْلَتَنَا مَالِ هَـٰذَا ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَا يُغَادِرُ صَغِيرَةً وَلَا كَبِيرَةً إِلَّآ أَحْصَىٰهَا ۚ وَوَجَدُوا۟ مَا عَمِلُوا۟ حَاضِرًا ۗ وَلَا يَظْلِمُ رَبُّكَ أَحَدًا
ayas.translation: And the Book shall be placed, then you will see the guilty fearing from what is in it, and they will say: Ah! woe to us! what a book is this! it does not omit a small one nor a great one, but numbers them (all); and what they had done they shall find present (there); and your Lord does not deal unjustly with anyone.
ayas.transliteration: wawuḍi`al kitābu fataral mujrimīna mushfiqīna mimmā fīhi wayaqūlūna yāwaylatanā māli hādhal kitābi lā yughādiru ṣaghīratan walā kabīratan illā aḥṣāhā ۚ wawajadū mā `amilū ḥāḍirā ۗ walā yaẓlimu rabbuka aḥadā

ayas.arabic: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ ٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِـَٔادَمَ فَسَجَدُوٓا۟ إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَفَسَقَ عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِۦٓ ۗ أَفَتَتَّخِذُونَهُۥ وَذُرِّيَّتَهُۥٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ مِن دُونِى وَهُمْ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّۢ ۚ بِئْسَ لِلظَّـٰلِمِينَ بَدَلًا
ayas.translation: And when We said to the angels: Make obeisance to Adam; they made obeisance but Iblis (did it not). He was of the jinn, so he transgressed the commandment of his Lord. What! would you then take him and his offspring for friends rather than Me, and they are your enemies? Evil is (this) change for the unjust.
ayas.transliteration: wa idh qulnā lil-malā-ikatis-judū li-ādama fasajadū illā iblīsa kāna minal jinni fafasaqa `an amri rabbih ۗ afatattakhidhūnahu wadhurriyyatahu awliyā-a min dūnī wahum lakum `aduww ۚ bi-sa liẓẓālimīna badalā

ayas.arabic: مَّآ أَشْهَدتُّهُمْ خَلْقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا خَلْقَ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَمَا كُنتُ مُتَّخِذَ ٱلْمُضِلِّينَ عَضُدًا
ayas.translation: I did not make them witnesses of the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor of the creation of their own souls; nor could I take those who lead (others) astray for aiders.
ayas.transliteration: mā ash-hadtuhum khalqas samāwāti wal-arḍi walā khalqa anfusihim wa mā kuntu muttakhidhal muḍillīna `aḍudā

ayas.arabic: وَيَوْمَ يَقُولُ نَادُوا۟ شُرَكَآءِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ زَعَمْتُمْ فَدَعَوْهُمْ فَلَمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لَهُمْ وَجَعَلْنَا بَيْنَهُم مَّوْبِقًا
ayas.translation: And on the day when He shall say: Call on those whom you considered to be My associates. So they shall call on them, but they shall not answer them, and We will cause a separation between them.
ayas.transliteration: wayawma yaqūlu nādū shurakā-iyal ladhīna za`amtum fada`awhum falam yastajībū lahum waja`alnā baynahum mawbiqā

ayas.arabic: وَرَءَا ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ ٱلنَّارَ فَظَنُّوٓا۟ أَنَّهُم مُّوَاقِعُوهَا وَلَمْ يَجِدُوا۟ عَنْهَا مَصْرِفًا
ayas.translation: And the guilty shall see the fire, then they shall know that they are going to fall into it, and they shall not find a place to which to turn away from it.
ayas.transliteration: wara al mujrimūnan nāra faẓannū annahum muwāqi`ūhā walam yajidū `anhā maṣrifā

ayas.arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَا فِى هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانِ لِلنَّاسِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍ ۚ وَكَانَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ أَكْثَرَ شَىْءٍ جَدَلًا
ayas.translation: And certainly We have explained in this Quran every kind of example, and man is most of all given to contention.
ayas.transliteration: walaqad ṣarrafnā fī hādhal qur-āni linnāsi min kulli mathal ۚ wakānal-insānu akthara shay-in jadalā

ayas.arabic: وَمَا مَنَعَ ٱلنَّاسَ أَن يُؤْمِنُوٓا۟ إِذْ جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْهُدَىٰ وَيَسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّهُمْ إِلَّآ أَن تَأْتِيَهُمْ سُنَّةُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ أَوْ يَأْتِيَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ قُبُلًا
ayas.translation: And nothing prevents men from believing when the guidance comes to them, and from asking forgiveness of their Lord, except that what happened to the ancients should overtake them, or that the chastisement should come face to face with them.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā mana`an nāsa an yu-minū idh jā-ahumul hudā wayastaghfirū rabbahum illā an ta-tiyahum sunnatul-awwalīna aw ya-tiyahumul `adhābu qubulā

ayas.arabic: وَمَا نُرْسِلُ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرِينَ وَمُنذِرِينَ ۚ وَيُجَـٰدِلُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِٱلْبَـٰطِلِ لِيُدْحِضُوا۟ بِهِ ٱلْحَقَّ ۖ وَٱتَّخَذُوٓا۟ ءَايَـٰتِى وَمَآ أُنذِرُوا۟ هُزُوًا
ayas.translation: And We do not send apostles but as givers of good news and warning, and those who disbelieve make a false contention that they may render null thereby the truth, and they take My communications and that with which they are warned for a mockery.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā nursilul mursalīna illā mubashhirīna wa mundhirīn ۚ wayujādilul ladhīna kafarū bil bāṭili liyud-ḥiḍū bihil ḥaqq ۖ wattakhadhū āyātī wa mā undhirū huzuwā

ayas.arabic: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّن ذُكِّرَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِۦ فَأَعْرَضَ عَنْهَا وَنَسِىَ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ ۚ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ أَكِنَّةً أَن يَفْقَهُوهُ وَفِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ وَقْرًا ۖ وَإِن تَدْعُهُمْ إِلَى ٱلْهُدَىٰ فَلَن يَهْتَدُوٓا۟ إِذًا أَبَدًا
ayas.translation: And who is more unjust than he who is reminded of the communications of his Lord, then he turns away from them and forgets what his two hands have sent before? Surely We have placed veils over their hearts lest they should understand it and a heaviness in their ears; and if you call them to the guidance, they will not ever follow the right course in that case.
ayas.transliteration: wa man aẓlamu mimman dhukkira bi-āyāti rabbihi fa-a`raḍa `anhā wanasiya mā qaddamat yadāh ۚ innā ja`alnā `alā qulūbihim akinnatan an yafqahūhu wafī ādhānihim waqrā ۖ wa in tad`uhum ilal-hudā falan yahtadū idhan abadā

ayas.arabic: وَرَبُّكَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ذُو ٱلرَّحْمَةِ ۖ لَوْ يُؤَاخِذُهُم بِمَا كَسَبُوا۟ لَعَجَّلَ لَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابَ ۚ بَل لَّهُم مَّوْعِدٌ لَّن يَجِدُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦ مَوْئِلًا
ayas.translation: And your Lord is Forgiving, the Lord of Mercy; were He to punish them for what they earn, He would certainly have hastened the chastisement for them; but for them there is an appointed time from which they shall not find a refuge.
ayas.transliteration: warabbukal ghafūru dhur raḥmah ۖ law yu-ākhidhuhum bimā kasabū la`ajjala lahumul `adhāb ۚ bal lahum maw`idul lan yajidū min dūnihi maw-ilā

ayas.arabic: وَتِلْكَ ٱلْقُرَىٰٓ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهُمْ لَمَّا ظَلَمُوا۟ وَجَعَلْنَا لِمَهْلِكِهِم مَّوْعِدًا
ayas.translation: And (as for) these towns, We destroyed them when they acted unjustly, and We have appointed a time for their destruction.
ayas.transliteration: watilkal qurā ahlaknāhum lammā ẓalamū waja`alnā limahlikihim maw`idā

ayas.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِفَتَىٰهُ لَآ أَبْرَحُ حَتَّىٰٓ أَبْلُغَ مَجْمَعَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ أَوْ أَمْضِىَ حُقُبًا
ayas.translation: And when Musa said to his servant: I will not cease until I reach the junction of the two rivers or I will go on for years.
ayas.transliteration: wa idh qāla mūsā lifatāhu lā abraḥu ḥattā ablugha majma`al baḥrayni aw amḍiya ḥuqubā

ayas.arabic: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَا مَجْمَعَ بَيْنِهِمَا نَسِيَا حُوتَهُمَا فَٱتَّخَذَ سَبِيلَهُۥ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ سَرَبًا
ayas.translation: So when they had reached the junction of the two (rivers) they forgot their fish, and it took its way into the sea, going away.
ayas.transliteration: falammā balaghā majma`a baynihimā nasiyā ḥūtahumā fattakhadha sabīlahu fil baḥri sarabā

ayas.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاوَزَا قَالَ لِفَتَىٰهُ ءَاتِنَا غَدَآءَنَا لَقَدْ لَقِينَا مِن سَفَرِنَا هَـٰذَا نَصَبًا
ayas.translation: But when they had gone farther, he said to his servant: Bring to us our morning meal, certainly we have met with fatigue from this our journey.
ayas.transliteration: falammā jāwazā qāla lifatāhu ātinā ghadā-anā laqad laqīnā min safarinā hādhā naṣabā

ayas.arabic: قَالَ أَرَءَيْتَ إِذْ أَوَيْنَآ إِلَى ٱلصَّخْرَةِ فَإِنِّى نَسِيتُ ٱلْحُوتَ وَمَآ أَنسَىٰنِيهُ إِلَّا ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ أَنْ أَذْكُرَهُۥ ۚ وَٱتَّخَذَ سَبِيلَهُۥ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ عَجَبًا
ayas.translation: He said: Did you see when we took refuge on the rock then I forgot the fish, and nothing made me forget to speak of it but the Shaitan, and it took its way into the river; what a wonder!
ayas.transliteration: qāla ara ayta idh awaynā ilaṣ ṣakhrati fa-innī nasītul ḥūta wa mā ansānīhu illash shayṭānu an adhkurah ۚ wattakhadha sabīlahu fil baḥri `ajabā

ayas.arabic: قَالَ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنَّا نَبْغِ ۚ فَٱرْتَدَّا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَارِهِمَا قَصَصًا
ayas.translation: He said: This is what we sought for; so they returned retracing their footsteps.
ayas.transliteration: qāla dhālika mā kunnā nabgh ۚ fartaddā `alā āthārihimā qaṣaṣā

ayas.arabic: فَوَجَدَا عَبْدًا مِّنْ عِبَادِنَآ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ رَحْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنَا وَعَلَّمْنَـٰهُ مِن لَّدُنَّا عِلْمًا
ayas.translation: Then they found one from among Our servants whom We had granted mercy from Us and whom We had taught knowledge from Ourselves.
ayas.transliteration: fawajadā `abdan min `ibādinā ātaynāhu raḥmatan min `indinā wa`allamnāhu min ladunnā `il-mā

ayas.arabic: قَالَ لَهُۥ مُوسَىٰ هَلْ أَتَّبِعُكَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن تُعَلِّمَنِ مِمَّا عُلِّمْتَ رُشْدًا
ayas.translation: Musa said to him: Shall I follow you on condition that you should teach me right knowledge of what you have been taught?
ayas.transliteration: qāla lahu mūsā hal attabi`uka `alā an tu`allimani mimmā `ullimta rushdā

ayas.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِىَ صَبْرًا
ayas.translation: He said: Surely you cannot have patience with me
ayas.transliteration: qāla innaka lan tastaṭī`a ma`iya ṣabrā

ayas.arabic: وَكَيْفَ تَصْبِرُ عَلَىٰ مَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِۦ خُبْرًا
ayas.translation: And how can you have patience in that of which you have not got a comprehensive knowledge?
ayas.transliteration: wakayfa taṣbiru `alā mā lam tuḥiṭ bihi khubrā

ayas.arabic: قَالَ سَتَجِدُنِىٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ صَابِرًا وَلَآ أَعْصِى لَكَ أَمْرًا
ayas.translation: He said: If Allah pleases, you will find me patient and I shall not disobey you in any matter.
ayas.transliteration: qāla satajidunī in shā-allāhu ṣābiran walā a`ṣī laka amrā

ayas.arabic: قَالَ فَإِنِ ٱتَّبَعْتَنِى فَلَا تَسْـَٔلْنِى عَن شَىْءٍ حَتَّىٰٓ أُحْدِثَ لَكَ مِنْهُ ذِكْرًا
ayas.translation: He said: If you would follow me, then do not question me about any thing until I myself speak to you about it
ayas.transliteration: qāla fa-init-taba`tanī falā tas-alnī `an shay-in ḥattā uḥditha laka minhu dhikrā

ayas.arabic: فَٱنطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَكِبَا فِى ٱلسَّفِينَةِ خَرَقَهَا ۖ قَالَ أَخَرَقْتَهَا لِتُغْرِقَ أَهْلَهَا لَقَدْ جِئْتَ شَيْـًٔا إِمْرًا
ayas.translation: So they went (their way) until when they embarked in the boat he made a hole in it. (Musa) said: Have you made a hole in it to drown its inmates? Certainly you have done a grievous thing.
ayas.transliteration: fanṭalaqā ḥattā idhā rakibā fis safīnati kharaqahā ۖ qāla akharaqtahā litughriqa ahlahā laqad ji-ta shay-an imrā

ayas.arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُلْ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِىَ صَبْرًا
ayas.translation: He said: Did I not say that you will not be able to have patience with me?
ayas.transliteration: qāla alam aqul innaka lan tastaṭī`a ma`iya ṣabrā

ayas.arabic: قَالَ لَا تُؤَاخِذْنِى بِمَا نَسِيتُ وَلَا تُرْهِقْنِى مِنْ أَمْرِى عُسْرًا
ayas.translation: He said: Blame me not for what I forgot, and do not constrain me to a difficult thing in my affair.
ayas.transliteration: qāla lā tu-ākhidhnī bimā nasītu walā turhiqnī min amrī `usrā

ayas.arabic: فَٱنطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا لَقِيَا غُلَـٰمًا فَقَتَلَهُۥ قَالَ أَقَتَلْتَ نَفْسًا زَكِيَّةًۢ بِغَيْرِ نَفْسٍ لَّقَدْ جِئْتَ شَيْـًٔا نُّكْرًا
ayas.translation: So they went on until, when they met a boy, he slew him. (Musa) said: Have you slain an innocent person otherwise than for manslaughter? Certainly you have done an evil thing.
ayas.transliteration: fanṭalaqā ḥattā idhā laqiyā ghulāman faqatalahu qāla aqatalta nafsan zakiyyatan bighayri nafsin laqad ji-ta shay-an nukrā

ayas.arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِىَ صَبْرًا
ayas.translation: He said: Did I not say to you that you will not be able to have patience with me?
ayas.transliteration: qāla alam aqul laka innaka lan tastaṭī`a ma`iya ṣabrā

ayas.arabic: قَالَ إِن سَأَلْتُكَ عَن شَىْءٍۭ بَعْدَهَا فَلَا تُصَـٰحِبْنِى ۖ قَدْ بَلَغْتَ مِن لَّدُنِّى عُذْرًا
ayas.translation: He said: If I ask you about anything after this, keep me not in your company; indeed you shall have (then) found an excuse in my case.
ayas.transliteration: qāla in sa-altuka `an shay-in ba`dahā falā tuṣāḥibnī ۖ qad balaghta min ladunnī `udhrā

ayas.arabic: فَٱنطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَتَيَآ أَهْلَ قَرْيَةٍ ٱسْتَطْعَمَآ أَهْلَهَا فَأَبَوْا۟ أَن يُضَيِّفُوهُمَا فَوَجَدَا فِيهَا جِدَارًا يُرِيدُ أَن يَنقَضَّ فَأَقَامَهُۥ ۖ قَالَ لَوْ شِئْتَ لَتَّخَذْتَ عَلَيْهِ أَجْرًا
ayas.translation: So they went on until when they came to the people of a town, they asked them for food, but they refused to entertain them as guests. Then they found in it a wall which was on the point of falling, so he put it into a right state. (Musa) said: If you had pleased, you might certainly have taken a recompense for it.
ayas.transliteration: fanṭalaqā ḥattā idhā atayā ahla qaryatinis-taṭ`amā ahlahā fa-abaw an yuḍayyifūhumā fawajadā fīhā jidāran yurīdu an yanqaḍḍa fa-aqāmah ۖ qāla law shi-ta lattakhadhta `alayhi ajrā

ayas.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذَا فِرَاقُ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنِكَ ۚ سَأُنَبِّئُكَ بِتَأْوِيلِ مَا لَمْ تَسْتَطِع عَّلَيْهِ صَبْرًا
ayas.translation: He said: This shall be separation between me and you; now I will inform you of the significance of that with which you could not have patience.
ayas.transliteration: qāla hādhā firāqu baynī wabaynik ۚ sa-unabbi-uka bita-wīli mā lam tastaṭi` `alayhi ṣabrā

ayas.arabic: أَمَّا ٱلسَّفِينَةُ فَكَانَتْ لِمَسَـٰكِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ فَأَرَدتُّ أَنْ أَعِيبَهَا وَكَانَ وَرَآءَهُم مَّلِكٌ يَأْخُذُ كُلَّ سَفِينَةٍ غَصْبًا
ayas.translation: As for the boat, it belonged to (some) poor men who worked on the river and I wished that I should damage it, and there was behind them a king who seized every boat by force.
ayas.transliteration: ammas safīnatu fakānat limasākīna ya`malūna fil baḥri fa-aradtu an a`ībahā wakāna warā-ahum malikun ya-khudhu kulla safīnatin ghaṣbā

ayas.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلْغُلَـٰمُ فَكَانَ أَبَوَاهُ مُؤْمِنَيْنِ فَخَشِينَآ أَن يُرْهِقَهُمَا طُغْيَـٰنًا وَكُفْرًا
ayas.translation: And as for the boy, his parents were believers and we feared lest he should make disobedience and ingratitude to come upon them:
ayas.transliteration: wa-ammal ghulāmu fakāna abawāhu mu-minayni fakhashīnā an yurhiqahumā ṭughyānan wakufrā

ayas.arabic: فَأَرَدْنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَهُمَا رَبُّهُمَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهُ زَكَوٰةً وَأَقْرَبَ رُحْمًا
ayas.translation: So we desired that their Lord might give them in his place one better than him in purity and nearer to having compassion.
ayas.transliteration: fa-aradnā an yubdilahumā rabbuhumā khayran minhu zakātan wa-aqraba ruḥmā

ayas.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلْجِدَارُ فَكَانَ لِغُلَـٰمَيْنِ يَتِيمَيْنِ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ وَكَانَ تَحْتَهُۥ كَنزٌ لَّهُمَا وَكَانَ أَبُوهُمَا صَـٰلِحًا فَأَرَادَ رَبُّكَ أَن يَبْلُغَآ أَشُدَّهُمَا وَيَسْتَخْرِجَا كَنزَهُمَا رَحْمَةً مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۚ وَمَا فَعَلْتُهُۥ عَنْ أَمْرِى ۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَأْوِيلُ مَا لَمْ تَسْطِع عَّلَيْهِ صَبْرًا
ayas.translation: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure belonging to them, and their father was a righteous man; so your Lord desired that they should attain their maturity and take out their treasure, a mercy from your Lord, and I did not do it of my own accord. This is the significance of that with which you could not have patience.
ayas.transliteration: wa-ammal jidāru fakāna lighulāmayni yatīmayni fil madīnati wakāna taḥtahu kanzul lahumā wakāna abūhumā ṣāliḥan fa-arāda rabbuka an yablughā ashuddahumā wayastakhrijā kanzahumā raḥmatan min rabbik ۚ wa mā fa`altuhu `an amrī ۚ dhālika ta-wīlu mā lam tasṭi` `alayhi ṣabrā

ayas.arabic: وَيَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَن ذِى ٱلْقَرْنَيْنِ ۖ قُلْ سَأَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْكُم مِّنْهُ ذِكْرًا
ayas.translation: And they ask you about Zulqarnain. Say: I will recite to you an account of him.
ayas.transliteration: wayas-alūnaka `an dhil qarnayn ۖ qul sa-atlū `alaykum minhu dhikrā

ayas.arabic: إِنَّا مَكَّنَّا لَهُۥ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ سَبَبًا
ayas.translation: Surely We established him in the land and granted him means of access to every thing.
ayas.transliteration: innā makkannā lahu fil-arḍi wa-ātaynāhu min kulli shay-in sababā

ayas.arabic: فَأَتْبَعَ سَبَبًا
ayas.translation: So he followed a course.
ayas.transliteration: fa-atba`a sababā

ayas.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغَ مَغْرِبَ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَجَدَهَا تَغْرُبُ فِى عَيْنٍ حَمِئَةٍ وَوَجَدَ عِندَهَا قَوْمًا ۗ قُلْنَا يَـٰذَا ٱلْقَرْنَيْنِ إِمَّآ أَن تُعَذِّبَ وَإِمَّآ أَن تَتَّخِذَ فِيهِمْ حُسْنًا
ayas.translation: Until when he reached the place where the sun set, he found it going down into a black sea, and found by it a people. We said: O Zulqarnain! either give them a chastisement or do them a benefit.
ayas.transliteration: ḥattā idhā balagha maghribash shamsi wajadahā taghrubu fī `aynin ḥami-atin wawajada `indahā qawmā ۗ qulnā yādhal qarnayni immā an tu`adhhiba wa immā an tattakhidha fīhim ḥusnā

ayas.arabic: قَالَ أَمَّا مَن ظَلَمَ فَسَوْفَ نُعَذِّبُهُۥ ثُمَّ يُرَدُّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ فَيُعَذِّبُهُۥ عَذَابًا نُّكْرًا
ayas.translation: He said: As to him who is unjust, we will chastise him, then shall he be returned to his Lord, and He will chastise him with an exemplary chastisement:
ayas.transliteration: qāla ammā man ẓalama fasawfa nu`adhhibuhu thumma yuraddu ilā rabbihi fayu`adhhibuhu `adhāban nukrā

ayas.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ ءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًا فَلَهُۥ جَزَآءً ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ ۖ وَسَنَقُولُ لَهُۥ مِنْ أَمْرِنَا يُسْرًا
ayas.translation: And as for him who believes and does good, he shall have goodly reward, and We will speak to him an easy word of Our command.
ayas.transliteration: wa-ammā man āmana wa`amila ṣāliḥan falahu jazā-anil-ḥusnā ۖ wasanaqūlu lahu min amrinā yusrā

ayas.arabic: ثُمَّ أَتْبَعَ سَبَبًا
ayas.translation: Then he followed (another) course.
ayas.transliteration: thumma atba`a sababā

ayas.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغَ مَطْلِعَ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَجَدَهَا تَطْلُعُ عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍ لَّمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُم مِّن دُونِهَا سِتْرًا
ayas.translation: Until when he reached the land of the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people to whom We had given no shelter from It;
ayas.transliteration: ḥattā idhā balagha maṭli`ash shamsi wajadahā taṭlu`u `alā qawmin lam naj`al lahum min dūnihā sitrā

ayas.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ وَقَدْ أَحَطْنَا بِمَا لَدَيْهِ خُبْرًا
ayas.translation: Even so! and We had a full knowledge of what he had.
ayas.transliteration: kadhālika waqad aḥaṭnā bimā ladayhi khubrā

ayas.arabic: ثُمَّ أَتْبَعَ سَبَبًا
ayas.translation: Then he followed (another) course.
ayas.transliteration: thumma atba`a sababā

ayas.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغَ بَيْنَ ٱلسَّدَّيْنِ وَجَدَ مِن دُونِهِمَا قَوْمًا لَّا يَكَادُونَ يَفْقَهُونَ قَوْلًا
ayas.translation: Until when he reached (a place) between the two mountains, he found on that side of them a people who could hardly understand a word.
ayas.transliteration: ḥattā idhā balagha baynas saddayni wajada min dūnihimā qawmal lā yakādūna yafqahūna qawlā

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰذَا ٱلْقَرْنَيْنِ إِنَّ يَأْجُوجَ وَمَأْجُوجَ مُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَهَلْ نَجْعَلُ لَكَ خَرْجًا عَلَىٰٓ أَن تَجْعَلَ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَهُمْ سَدًّا
ayas.translation: They said: O Zulqarnain! surely Gog and Magog make mischief in the land. Shall we then pay you a tribute on condition that you should raise a barrier between us and them
ayas.transliteration: qālū yādhal qarnayni inna ya-jūja wa ma-jūja mufsidūna fil-arḍi fahal naj`alu laka kharjan `alā an taj`ala baynanā wabaynahum saddā

ayas.arabic: قَالَ مَا مَكَّنِّى فِيهِ رَبِّى خَيْرٌ فَأَعِينُونِى بِقُوَّةٍ أَجْعَلْ بَيْنَكُمْ وَبَيْنَهُمْ رَدْمًا
ayas.translation: He said: That in which my Lord has established me is better, therefore you only help me with workers, I will make a fortified barrier between you and them;
ayas.transliteration: qāla mā makkannī fīhi rabbī khayrun fa-a`īnūnī biquwwatin aj`al baynakum wabaynahum radmā

ayas.arabic: ءَاتُونِى زُبَرَ ٱلْحَدِيدِ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا سَاوَىٰ بَيْنَ ٱلصَّدَفَيْنِ قَالَ ٱنفُخُوا۟ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَعَلَهُۥ نَارًا قَالَ ءَاتُونِىٓ أُفْرِغْ عَلَيْهِ قِطْرًا
ayas.translation: Bring me blocks of iron; until when he had filled up the space between the two mountain sides, he said: Blow, until when he had made it (as) fire, he said: Bring me molten brass which I may pour over it.
ayas.transliteration: ātūnī zubaral ḥadīd ۖ ḥattā idhā sāwā baynaṣ ṣadafayni qālan-fukhū ۖ ḥattā idhā ja`alahu nāran qāla ātūnī ufrigh `alayhi qiṭrā

ayas.arabic: فَمَا ٱسْطَـٰعُوٓا۟ أَن يَظْهَرُوهُ وَمَا ٱسْتَطَـٰعُوا۟ لَهُۥ نَقْبًا
ayas.translation: So they were not able to scale it nor could they make a hole in it.
ayas.transliteration: famas-ṭā`ū an yaẓharūhu wa mas-taṭā`ū lahu naqbā

ayas.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذَا رَحْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّى ۖ فَإِذَا جَآءَ وَعْدُ رَبِّى جَعَلَهُۥ دَكَّآءَ ۖ وَكَانَ وَعْدُ رَبِّى حَقًّا
ayas.translation: He said: This is a mercy from my Lord, but when the promise of my Lord comes to pass He will make it level with the ground, and the promise of my Lord is ever true.
ayas.transliteration: qāla hādhā raḥmatun min rabbī ۖ fa-idhā jā-a wa`du rabbī ja`alahu dakkā-a ۖ wakāna wa`du rabbī ḥaqqā

ayas.arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَمُوجُ فِى بَعْضٍ ۖ وَنُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَجَمَعْنَـٰهُمْ جَمْعًا
ayas.translation: And on that day We will leave a part of them in conflict with another part, and the trumpet will be blown, so We will gather them all together;
ayas.transliteration: wataraknā ba`ḍahum yawma-idhiy yamūju fī ba`ḍ ۖ wanufikha fiṣ ṣūri fajama`nāhum jam`ā

ayas.arabic: وَعَرَضْنَا جَهَنَّمَ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْكَـٰفِرِينَ عَرْضًا
ayas.translation: And We will bring forth hell, exposed to view, on that day before the unbelievers.
ayas.transliteration: wa`araḍnā jahannama yawma-idhin lilkāfirīna `arḍā

ayas.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ كَانَتْ أَعْيُنُهُمْ فِى غِطَآءٍ عَن ذِكْرِى وَكَانُوا۟ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَمْعًا
ayas.translation: They whose eyes were under a cover from My reminder and they could not even hear.
ayas.transliteration: alladhīna kānat a`yunuhum fī ghiṭā-in `an dhikrī wakānū lā yastaṭī`ūna sam`ā

ayas.arabic: أَفَحَسِبَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَن يَتَّخِذُوا۟ عِبَادِى مِن دُونِىٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ ۚ إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا جَهَنَّمَ لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ نُزُلًا
ayas.translation: What! do then those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants to be guardians besides Me? Surely We have prepared hell for the entertainment of the unbelievers.
ayas.transliteration: afaḥasibal ladhīna kafarū an yattakhidhū `ibādī min dūnī awliyā-a ۚ innā a`tadnā jahannama lilkāfirīna nuzulā

ayas.arabic: قُلْ هَلْ نُنَبِّئُكُم بِٱلْأَخْسَرِينَ أَعْمَـٰلًا
ayas.translation: Say: Shall We inform you of the greatest losers in (their) deeds?
ayas.transliteration: qul hal nunabbi-ukum bil-akhsarīna a`mālā

ayas.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ضَلَّ سَعْيُهُمْ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَهُمْ يَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّهُمْ يُحْسِنُونَ صُنْعًا
ayas.translation: (These are) they whose labor is lost in this world's life and they think that they are well versed in skill of the work of hands.
ayas.transliteration: alladhīna ḍalla sa`yuhum fil ḥayātid dunyā wahum yaḥsabūna annahum yuḥsinūna ṣun`ā

ayas.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَلِقَآئِهِۦ فَحَبِطَتْ أَعْمَـٰلُهُمْ فَلَا نُقِيمُ لَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ وَزْنًا
ayas.translation: These are they who disbelieve in the communications of their Lord and His meeting, so their deeds become null, and therefore We will not set up a balance for them on the day of resurrection.
ayas.transliteration: ulā-ikal ladhīna kafarū bi-āyāti rabbihim waliqā-ihi faḥabiṭat a`māluhum falā nuqīmu lahum yawmal qiyāmati waznā

ayas.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ جَزَآؤُهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ بِمَا كَفَرُوا۟ وَٱتَّخَذُوٓا۟ ءَايَـٰتِى وَرُسُلِى هُزُوًا
ayas.translation: Thus it is that their recompense is hell, because they disbelieved and held My communications and My apostles in mockery.
ayas.transliteration: dhālika jazā-uhum jahannamu bimā kafarū wattakhadhū āyātī warusulī huzuwā

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ كَانَتْ لَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتُ ٱلْفِرْدَوْسِ نُزُلًا
ayas.translation: Surely (as for) those who believe and do good deeds, their place of entertainment shall be the gardens of paradise,
ayas.transliteration: innal ladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti kānat lahum jannātul firdawsi nuzulā

ayas.arabic: خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا لَا يَبْغُونَ عَنْهَا حِوَلًا
ayas.translation: Abiding therein; they shall not desire removal from them.
ayas.transliteration: khālidīna fīhā lā yabghūna `anhā ḥiwalā

ayas.arabic: قُل لَّوْ كَانَ ٱلْبَحْرُ مِدَادًا لِّكَلِمَـٰتِ رَبِّى لَنَفِدَ ٱلْبَحْرُ قَبْلَ أَن تَنفَدَ كَلِمَـٰتُ رَبِّى وَلَوْ جِئْنَا بِمِثْلِهِۦ مَدَدًا
ayas.translation: Say: If the sea were ink for the words of my Lord, the sea would surely be consumed before the words of my Lord are exhausted, though We were to bring the like of that (sea) to add
ayas.transliteration: qul law kānal baḥru midādal likalimāti rabbī lanafidal baḥru qabla an tanfada kalimātu rabbī walaw ji-nā bimithlihi madadā

ayas.arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُكُمْ يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَىَّ أَنَّمَآ إِلَـٰهُكُمْ إِلَـٰهٌ وَٰحِدٌ ۖ فَمَن كَانَ يَرْجُوا۟ لِقَآءَ رَبِّهِۦ فَلْيَعْمَلْ عَمَلًا صَـٰلِحًا وَلَا يُشْرِكْ بِعِبَادَةِ رَبِّهِۦٓ أَحَدًۢا
ayas.translation: Say: I am only a mortal like you; it is revealed to me that your god is one Allah, therefore whoever hopes to meet his Lord, he should do good deeds, and not join any one in the service of his Lord.
ayas.transliteration: qul innamā ana basharun mithlukum yūḥā ilayya annamā ilāhukum ilāhun wāḥid ۖ faman kāna yarjū liqā-a rabbihi falya`mal `amalan ṣāliḥan walā yushrik bi`ibādati rabbihi aḥadā
